intro: Telanthera snodgrassii, commonly known as the Snodgrass's telanthera, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
